verses.verse: Now these<WH428> are the ones who came<WH935> to David<WH1732> at Ziklag,<WH6860> while he was still<WH5750> restricted<WH6113> because<WH4480> <WH6440> of Saul<WH7586> the son<WH1121> of Kish;<WH7027> and they were among the mighty<WH1368> men<WH1368> who helped<WH5826> [him] in war.<WH4421>

Attai<WH6262> the sixth,<WH8345> Eliel<WH447> the seventh,<WH7637>

These<WH428> of the sons<WH1121> of Gad<WH1410> were captains<WH7218> of the army;<WH6635> he who was least<WH6996> was equal to a hundred<WH3967> and the greatest<WH1419> to a thousand.<WH505>

These<WH428> are the ones<WH1992> who<WH834> crossed<WH5674> the Jordan<WH3383> in the first<WH7223> month<WH2320> when it was overflowing<WH4390> <WH5921> all<WH3605> its banks<WH1415> and they put<WH1272> to flight<WH1272> all<WH3605> those in the valleys,<WH6010> both to the east<WH4217> and to the west.<WH4628>

And David<WH1732> went<WH3318> out to meet<WH6440> them, and answered<WH6030> and said<WH559> to them, "If<WH518> you come<WH935> peacefully<WH7965> to me to help<WH5826> me, my heart<WH3824> shall be united<WH3162> with you; but if<WH518> to betray<WH7411> me to my adversaries,<WH6862> since there is no<WH3808> wrong<WH2555> in my hands,<WH3709> may the God<WH430> of our fathers look<WH1> on [it] and decide.<WH7200>"

Then the Spirit<WH7307> came<WH3847> upon Amasai,<WH6022> who was the chief<WH7218> of the thirty,<WH7970> [and he said,] "[We] are yours, O David,<WH1732> And with you, O son<WH1121> of Jesse!<WH3448> Peace,<WH7965> peace<WH7965> to you, And peace<WH7965> to him who helps<WH5826> you; Indeed,<WH3588> your God<WH430> helps<WH5826> you!" From Manasseh<WH4519> also some<WH4480> defected<WH5307> to David,<WH1732> when he was about to go<WH935> to battle<WH4421> with the Philistines<WH6430> against<WH5921> Saul.<WH7586> But they did not help<WH5826> them, for the lords<WH5633> of the Philistines<WH6430> after consultation<WH6098> sent<WH7971> him away,<WH7971> saying,<WH559> "At [the cost of] our heads<WH7218> he may defect<WH5307> to his master<WH113> Saul.<WH7586>"

And they helped<WH5826> David<WH1732> against<WH5921> the band<WH1416> of raiders,<WH1416> for they were all<WH3605> mighty<WH1368> men<WH1368> of valor,<WH2428> and were captains<WH8269> in the army.<WH6635>
For day<WH3117> by day<WH3117> [men] came<WH935> to David<WH1732> to help<WH5826> him, until<WH5704> there was a great<WH1419> army<WH4264> like the army<WH4264> of God.<WH430>

Now these<WH428> are the numbers<WH4557> of the divisions<WH7218> equipped<WH9139> for war,<WH6635> who came<WH935> to David<WH1732> at Hebron,<WH2275> to turn<WH5437> the kingdom<WH4438> of Saul<WH7586> to him, according to the word<WH6310> of the Lord.<WH3068>
The sons<WH1121> of Judah<WH3063> who bore<WH5375> shield<WH6793> and spear<WH7420> [were] 6800, equipped<WH9139> for war.<WH6635>
Of the sons<WH1121> of Simeon,<WH8095> mighty<WH1368> men<WH1368> of valor<WH2428> for war,<WH6635> 7100.
Of the sons<WH1121> of Levi<WH3878> 4600.
Now Jehoiada<WH3077> was the leader<WH5057> of [the house of] Aaron,<WH175> and with him were 3700,
also Zadok,<WH6659> a young<WH5288> man<WH5288> mighty<WH1368> of valor,<WH2428> and of his father's house<WH1004> twenty-two captains.<WH8269>

And of the sons<WH1121> of Benjamin,<WH1144> Saul<WH7586>'s kinsmen,<WH251> 3000; for until<WH5704> now<WH2008> the greatest<WH4768> part<WH4768> of them had kept<WH8104> their allegiance<WH4931> to the house<WH1004> of Saul.
And of the sons<WH1121> of Ephraim<WH669> 20800, mighty<WH1368> men<WH1368> of valor,<WH2428> famous<WH8034> men<WH376> in their fathers' households.<WH1004>
And of the half-tribe of Manasseh<WH4519> 18000, who<WH834> were designated<WH9344> by name<WH8034> to come<WH935> and make<WH4427> David<WH1732> king.<WH4427>

And of the sons<WH1121> of Issachar,<WH3485> men who understood<WH998> the times,<WH6256> with knowledge<WH3045> of what<WH4100> Israel<WH3478> should do,<WH6213> their chiefs<WH7218> were two hundred;<WH3967> and all<WH3605> their kinsmen<WH251> were at their command.<WH6310>

Of Zebulun,<WH2074> there were 50000 who went<WH3318> out in the army,<WH6635> who could draw<WH6186> up in battle<WH4421> formation<WH6186> with all<WH3605> kinds of weapons<WH3627> of war<WH4421> and helped<WH9385> [David] with an undivided<WH3808> <WH3820> heart.<WH3820>

And from the other<WH5676> side<WH5676> of the Jordan,<WH3383> of the Reubenites<WH7206> and the Gadites<WH1425> and of the half-tribe of Manasseh,<WH4519> [there were] 120000 with all<WH3605> [kinds] of weapons<WH3627> of war<WH6635> for the battle.<WH4421>
